title: Pakistan’s first mega festival ‘DreamFest 2025’ to initiate on Oct 17
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 16 (APP): Pakistan’s first-ever mega festival, DreamFest 2025 is set to take place from 17th to 19th October 2025 at the Jinnah Sports Complex, Islamabad, celebrating sports, music, food, and culture.
This was announced during press conference at National Press Club on Thursday, attended by Jamal Raisani, Member National Assembly,  Edward Piro from the Romanian Embassy,  Sabina Zakir, The Millennium Education, International Singers Aman Khan and Abraham Cruz, Renowned actor Imran Abbas, Arslan Mushtaq, CEO Dream Sports Group, and Umair Khattak, Green Tourism Pakistan, said a press release.
During the event, the speakers highlighted that DreamFest 2025 aimed to bring together Pakistan’s rich cultural diversity and global talent under one platform — offering families three days of unforgettable entertainment, sports competitions, food stalls, and musical performances.
The music lineup included Asim Azhar, Young Stunners, Nimra Mehra, Havi, Samar Jafri, and several other artists ready to light up the stage with electrifying performances.
A major highlight of the festival would be the Celebrities vs Diplomats Football Charity Match, where stars like Junaid Khan, Mani, Mohsin Abbas Haider, Faizan Shaikh, Bilal Qureshi, Agha Talal, and many others would take to the field.
A portion of the match ticket sales will be donated to flood relief efforts in Pakistan.
Tickets for DreamFest 2025 are now available on Bookme.pk.  The event promises a one-of-a-kind experience for people of all ages with concerts, cultural stalls, sports tournaments, and exciting activities throughout the three days.
